resources.string: Don\'t lock yourself in and don\'t let others do that to you.
Bypass conditional barriers and access markets globally.
Do not leak your private and financial data to the world.
Please use only latin letters and numbers for the passphrase

Passphrase add additional security layer to the wallets enabling users to create multiple independent multi-coin wallets using a single mnemonic recovery phrase (secret 12 words) but associated with different passwords. \n\nTo restore these wallets a user will require mnemonic recovery phrase as well as a password for each to be restored wallet.
Enjoying Unstoppable Wallet? Please take a moment to rate this app
Enter your mnemonic which consists of 12 or 24 words. The words needs to be entered in correct order and separated by spaces.
Wrong words count. Must be 12 or 24. You entered: %d
Enter your passphrase that you used when creating this mnemonic phrase.
If you know a birthday height for your Zcash wallet, add it below to speed up the syncing process.
Watchlist is empty.\nYou may add coins to watchlist using star icon on a coin page.
Token ratings based on project security and market liquidity.
Connecting real world data to smart contracts.
Markets to bet on events in the future.
Solutions for earning from idle crypto assets.

Stablecoins with algorithmic 1‚Äì1 price peg to fiat.

Platforms for creating decentralized synthetic assets.
Assets that pegged in price to a set of tokens.
Crypto projects in gaming and VR sector.
Tokens that periodically adjust supply to achieve a target price.
Digital fan tokens, typically specific to a team or club.

The historical change in ratio between the market cap of Bitcoin to the rest of the cryptocurrency markets. \n\nTypically, when Bitcoin dominance trending higher the rest of the crypto market trends down and vice versa.
The historical change in daily aggregate trading market volume for all cryptocurrencies.
The historical change in cumulative market value of tokens in Decentralized Finance sector.
The historical change in cumulative value of all cryptocurrency managed by decentralized protocols.
You need to backup the %1$s Wallet before you may receive %2$s.
You don\‚Äôt have any wallets yet. Create new or restore existing
You haven\'t added any coins to this wallet
Time locking works only with P2PKH addresses (starting with 1)
Unstoppable doesn\'t support payments to a transparent address
Sending to self is not supported
Transaction fees for %1$s (%2$s) paid in %3$s. You need %4$s.

Both Bitcoin and Ethereum blockchains require users to pay usage fees while sending transactions on the blockchain.\n\nUnstoppable uses public fee estimate services to help user determine appropriate transaction fees for the moment. The fees are higher when there are a lot of transactions taking place and lower when the blockchain is less busy.
Selecting a value from this range may result in transaction being pending for hours or being rejected entirely. The lower the value the longer it will take for the transaction to confirm.
Typically, this fee range should be sufficient for transaction to be processed within minutes/hour for Bitcoin and within minutes for Ethereum.

For transactions where priority is important we recommend using high fee setting. It\'s expected that selecting high fee setting will be sufficient for transaction to be completed within 10 minutes for Bitcoin and within a few minutes for Ethereum.\n\nThe Unstoppable wallet makes an educated guess based on the network activity and can\'t not guarantee that the suggested fee values will always result in expected behavior.
By clicking connect, you allow this app to view your public address. This is important security step to protect your data from potential phishing risks.
You can go to the browser. Do not close this page while interacting in the browser.
Please sign a message to authenticate
Current %s balance is below amount required to process this transaction including transaction fee.
Your Transaction will revert if the price change unfavorably by more than this percentage
Your Transaction will revert if it is pending for more than this long
After the exchange operation, the amount will be transferred to the specified address
Your transaction is likely to fail.

You should grant permission to a smart contract to swap given token on your behalf. This permission sets amount that can be used by a smart contract. It doesn\'t affect your balance but requires a small fee to execute approval transaction. \n\nWhile it may be done on demand before each trade, it\'s cheaper to approve higher amount in advance for future trades.
You already have an allowance for this amount

This exchange service is powered by %s, a decentralized token exchange protocol built on %s blockchain.\n\n%s is fully automated and managed by smart contracts that facilitate token exchanges in a reliable manner without any means to cheat.
The amount of some currency that service can spend on your behalf when executing token swaps. Sufficient allowance is required before swap action can take place
Expected price deviation from a shown price, typically increases with the swap amount.
A service fee for the swap action on platform, shown in the currency the user sells. For most orders it should be either 0.3 % or 0.6 %.
The minimum amount a user is going to receive as a result of a swap action.
The maximum amount a user is going to spend as a result of a swap action.
The estimated processing cost of the given transaction on %s blockchain. %s related transactions will typically cost more than generic token transfer transactions.
Transactions with higher transaction fee will result in faster processing speeds. The opposite is true as well.
You don\‚Äôt have any pending or past transactions yet
The transaction sent to own address

Transaction has not been confirmed on the blockchain yet. This step can take anywhere from a few minutes to a few hours depending on the transaction fee. Transactions sent with a very low fee usually get processed within a few days or can be rejected by network i.e. no transaction took place.

Transaction has been included in the blockchain but has not reached finality yet. At this point, it\'s safe to consider transaction completed for smaller payments. For larger payments it\'s recommended to wait until the status changes to completed.
Transaction did not get processed as intended and no token value transfer took place. On Ethereum blockchain failed transactions do consume transaction fees.

The sender sent these funds with a spending lock that will expire on %s.\n\nNo worries, the received Bitcoins are already yours but until the lock period expires you can not spend them on the Bitcoin network.
Double Spend Risk! There is another transaction on blockchain that trying to spend inputs used in this transaction. Only one transaction will be accepted by the network.

The exchange rate data provided by a third party service Coingecko.com\n\nUnstoppable wallet app doesn\'t guarantee these values are always correct and match market data. The chance for inconsistency is higher if you select any base currency other than %s.

This app doesn‚Äôt share any of your data. However, as it communicates with blockchains some public data like IP address can potentially be leaked. Use the info button on the top right to get detailed information about each section.
Select data source for restoring wallet with transactions.
Make your BTC, LTC, BCH transactions harder to trace by changing the way transactions are structured.
Below you will find detailed explanation of the privacy settings that are available in the app. It\'s safe to consider them as settings for those that require extensive privacy.

This setting controls the privacy level of user's transactions on Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash and Litecoin blockchains. 

Most Bitcoin transactions generate two outputs. One output is the amount that goes to the receiver and the other is the change output that is returned to the sender. The way most wallets construct transactions makes it easy for a third party monitoring Bitcoin blockchain to understand which of the outputs went to the receiving party and which one was the change amount returned to the sender. The output returned to the sender can then be used in future transactions and further reveal the details to the monitoring party. 

Unstoppable wallet implements measures to makes it significantly harder to figure out which output goes where. There are two options available to Unstoppable users: 

1. Shuffle : The order of transaction outputs are randomized on every transaction. Sometimes change can be the first output, sometimes it can be the second. If a user trusts the developer of the app, than consider this a recommended option. 

2. Deterministic : There is a commonly agreed standard for ordering transaction outputs (known as BIP69). In open source wallets that standard ensures that wallet users do not need to trust how developers of the app implement the ordering of the outputs. As this standard is new, not many wallets have implemented it yet. As a result, it's somewhat possible to see on the blockchain whether transaction was sent from the wallet that uses that standard or not.

This setting controls how this app interacts with blockchains (sending/receiving transactions). In case of Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, Litecoin and Dash it is fully peer to peer. The app pings many nodes and communicates with them. Potentially these nodes can record IP address and data requested but since they are chosen randomly, each time the app connects to a different node. 

In case of Ethereum, there is no alternative for mobile wallets to interact with blockchain other than via third party providers (i.e. Infura.io) or personal Ethereum nodes. Third party services can potentially record IP addresses and the requests made. That info can reveal location, balance, transactions etc. Moreover, the wallet has to trust that information returned is correct. There is a an alternative known as Incubed which in essence is a network of special Ethereum nodes. These nodes can also record IP addresses and requests made, but they are chosen randomly each time. While being slightly slower than Infura, the way Incubed works pretty much guarantees that the information returned is correct (not fake). 

When it comes to other blockchains like EOSIO and Binance Chain, at this point they only provide centralized means of connecting, without viable alternatives. Potentially they can be recording IP addresses and requests made.

This setting is only relevant when restoring an existing wallet. It is a process of getting transactions history for a given coin so that the wallet app is able to display past transactions and calculate user's balance. This needs to happen only once, when user restores previously created wallet. At this point there are two potential ways for a mobile wallet like Unstoppable to do this: 

1. from API Server : There is a third-party predefined server which hosts the entire blockchain and has all the data processed and ready to provide it in a fast manner. This method is fast but can potentially keep track of the IP addresses and the data requested. This option is recommended due to its speed of getting data (5-10 minutes). The risks are minimal. If the user restoring from his own server then no privacy risks at all. 

2. from Blockchain : In this case the app tries to restore directly from a p2p network of the blockchain nodes. The app pings many of those nodes and requests data from them. Potentially these nodes can keep track of user's IP address and requests made however during restore the app can switch between nodes. There are close to 10,000 Bitcoin nodes on the network at any given time. This option is slow and can easily take 2-3 hours, app needs to be open while restore is happening...
Enabling Biometric Authentication may potentially weaken the security of your device when compared to plain PIN lock code.
This action will restart Unstoppable Wallet.
Fully anonymize your internet traffic while using this app. Can be slow.
The notifications for Unstoppable Wallet app are disabled. You need to turn them on in order for Tor to work.

The Unstoppable wallet is built for those looking to invest and store cryptocurrencies in a private and independent manner. 

It's a non-custodial, peer-to-peer wallet where only the user has control over funds. It doesn't collect any data and keeps user independent by not locking his/her wallet to a specific wallet app. 

The Unstoppable wallet is fully open-source and anyone can confirm that the app works exactly as it claims to. 

We built Unstoppable for ourselves as the available solutions were not up to par. Both from engineering and usability perspective we believe this wallet to be significantly ahead of alternative products.
I went through the Academy section of this app and got familiar with the fundamental aspects of storing cryptocurrencies.
I have backed up the private key(s) for my wallets that were shown to me in a form of 12-24 words. I understand that these private keys are stored on my smartphone and not elsewhere.
I understand that passing my phone to untrusted entities and leaving the wallet app without safe PIN lock may potentially endanger the safety of my funds.
I understand that jail breaking (rooting) my phone, installing third party apps from unknown sources, keeping the operating system outdated can potentially endanger the safety of my funds.
I understand there may be undiscovered software issues in the code powering this wallet app which may potentially lead to unexpected behavior or the app malfunctioning.

I understand that I will need my private keys in order to restore access to my funds should I lose my phone or if the app malfunctions. Without my private keys it will be impossible to recover access to my wallet.
I understand that disabling the phone unlock PIN(or its equivalent) in Settings of Android OS will erase wallet private keys from my device. I will need my private keys to regain access to my funds.
I understand that only I myself is responsible for safety of my funds and no other entity.

Set price change alerts for the coins you would like to watch.

You will be alerted when the change in price for the last 24 hours exceeds selected threshold.

Price Trend Alert warns of a trend change for the short 1 week, for the long 6 month.
The notifications for Unstoppable Wallet app are disabled. You need to turn them on in order to be able to receive price change alerts.
Receiver requires non-empty memo in transfer transaction
Requires the memo to contain only digits

The features below are experimental and should be used with caution. While we have thoroughly tested these features using our own crypto funds we cannot guarantee they work as expected in all possible cases.

Enables you to send Bitcoins that can not be spent until specified date.

The receiver of such transaction should use Unstoppable wallet app version 0.10 or newer with BIP44 address format for the Bitcoin.

Only Unstoppable wallet can correctly identify such transactions on Bitcoin network as well as enable receiver to spend those Bitcoins after the lock period expires.

If you‚Äôre a HODLer, you may use this feature to force yourself into hodling your Bitcoins by sending such transaction to yourself.

Being an experimental feature the maximum amount per transaction is limited to 0.5 BTC.
Tip! Restoring an existing wallet but with a new passphrase will a generate a brand new wallet. Handy if you want to use a single 12-24 word mnemonic recovery phrase for multiple wallets.
You need to backup the private key for this wallet before it can be deleted from this phone.
This action will delete the selected wallet from this device.
All coins that belong to this wallet will be disabled on balance tab.
If you didn\'t backup the private key for this wallet, you will lose access to the funds on the selected wallet.

Please do not select Testnet options unless you understand what that is and how it works.\n\nTestnet is a parallel blockchain for testing purposes with its own currency. If someone sends a regular payment to your Testnet address, it will be lost.
The recovery phrase that will be shown next is the only way to restore your funds if your phone is ever lost, stolen, broken etc.\n\nMake sure that no one is watching your screen.
The recovery phrase that will be shown next is the only way to restore your funds if your phone is ever lost, stolen, broken etc.\n\nMake sure that no one is watching your screen.
Enter the recovery phrase in correct order to confirm
Entered words are empty or invalid
This action will delete the %s Wallet from this device.

Choose the address format for your %s wallet. Each selected format represents a different wallet on app\'s balance tab.

Activating TOR will reset Ethereum blockchain connection back to Infura.
Capital deposited into the platform in the form of loan collateral or liquidity pool.
Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator.
